<a id="WebSocketMultiplayerPeer"></a>

# WebSocketMultiplayerPeer

**Inherits:** [MultiplayerPeer](MultiplayerPeer.md) **\<** [PacketPeer](PacketPeer.md) **\<** [RefCounted](RefCounted.md) **\<** [Object](Object.md)

Base class for WebSocket server and client.

<!-- classref-introduction-group -->

## Description

Base class for WebSocket server and client, allowing them to be used as multiplayer peer for the [MultiplayerAPI](MultiplayerAPI.md).

\ **Note:** When exporting to Android, make sure to enable the ``INTERNET`` permission in the Android export preset before exporting the project or using one-click deploy. Otherwise, network communication of any kind will be blocked by Android.

<!-- classref-reftable-group -->

## Property Descriptions

<a id="WebSocketMultiplayerPeer_property_handshake_headers"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[PackedStringArray](PackedStringArray.md) **handshake_headers** = `PackedStringArray()` [ðŸ”—](#WebSocketMultiplayerPeer_property_handshake_headers)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_handshake_headers**\ (\ value\: [PackedStringArray](PackedStringArray.md)\ )
- [PackedStringArray](PackedStringArray.md) **get_handshake_headers**\ (\ )

The extra headers to use during handshake. See [WebSocketPeer.handshake_headers](WebSocketPeer.md#WebSocketPeer_property_handshake_headers) for more details.

**Note:** The returned array is *copied* and any changes to it will not update the original property value. See [PackedStringArray](PackedStringArray.md) for more details.

<!-- classref-property -->

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_handshake_timeout**\ (\ value\: [float](float.md)\ )
- [float](float.md) **get_handshake_timeout**\ (\ )

The maximum time each peer can stay in a connecting state before being dropped.

<!-- classref-descriptions-group -->

## Method Descriptions

<a id="WebSocketMultiplayerPeer_method_create_client"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[Error](@GlobalScope.md#enum_@GlobalScope_Error) **create_client**\ (\ url\: [String](String.md), tls_client_options\: [TLSOptions](TLSOptions.md) = null\ ) [ðŸ”—](#WebSocketMultiplayerPeer_method_create_client)

Starts a new multiplayer client connecting to the given `url`. TLS certificates will be verified against the hostname when connecting using the ``wss://`` protocol. You can pass the optional `tls_client_options` parameter to customize the trusted certification authorities, or disable the common name verification. See [TLSOptions.client()](TLSOptions.md#TLSOptions_method_client) and [TLSOptions.client_unsafe()](TLSOptions.md#TLSOptions_method_client_unsafe).

\ **Note:** It is recommended to specify the scheme part of the URL, i.e. the `url` should start with either ``ws://`` or ``wss://``.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="WebSocketMultiplayerPeer_method_create_server"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[Error](@GlobalScope.md#enum_@GlobalScope_Error) **create_server**\ (\ port\: [int](int.md), bind_address\: [String](String.md) = "*", tls_server_options\: [TLSOptions](TLSOptions.md) = null\ ) [ðŸ”—](#WebSocketMultiplayerPeer_method_create_server)

Starts a new multiplayer server listening on the given `port`. You can optionally specify a `bind_address`, and provide valid `tls_server_options` to use TLS. See [TLSOptions.server()](TLSOptions.md#TLSOptions_method_server).

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="WebSocketMultiplayerPeer_method_get_peer"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[WebSocketPeer](WebSocketPeer.md) **get_peer**\ (\ peer_id\: [int](int.md)\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#WebSocketMultiplayerPeer_method_get_peer)

Returns the [WebSocketPeer](WebSocketPeer.md) associated to the given `peer_id`.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="WebSocketMultiplayerPeer_method_get_peer_address"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[String](String.md) **get_peer_address**\ (\ id\: [int](int.md)\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#WebSocketMultiplayerPeer_method_get_peer_address)

Returns the IP address of the given peer.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="WebSocketMultiplayerPeer_method_get_peer_port"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[int](int.md) **get_peer_port**\ (\ id\: [int](int.md)\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#WebSocketMultiplayerPeer_method_get_peer_port)

Returns the remote port of the given peer.
